definition: to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The editor-in-chief blue- penciled the article written by his reporter.
sentences.chinese: 总编将他的采访记者所写的文章加以修改。

sentences.english: Some staffers described a sense of panic as the evacuation order came down.
sentences.chinese: 有采访记者描述了下达疏散令之后的恐慌气氛。

sentences.english: As soon as the reporters know what to write about, they Ret down to work.
sentences.chinese: 采访记者们一旦知道所要写的新闻，就着手工作。

definition: to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
to direct a television or radio broadcast/director (TV, radio)
to interview (a particular person or on a particular topic)/special interview/special report based on such an interview
well-known commentator/talking head/pundit/prominent TV or radio host
